title: Derby’s Take: Downward Trend Takes Bond-Yield Issue Off Powell’s Plate, for Now
body:
Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell likely will get a reprieve next week when it comes to questions about the bond market, but it may not last.
In the run-up to the Fed’s mid-March meeting, central bankers were routinely asked about rising long-term bond yields amid concerns they could slow the economic recovery and be a signal of market apprehension about future inflation rates.
